description: Sonar is the Schema for the sonars API.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: SonarSpec defines the desired state of Sonar.

defaultPermissionTemplate.description: DefaultPermissionTemplate is the name of the default permission template.

secret.description:
Secret is the name of the k8s object Secret related to sonar.
Secret should contain a user field with a sonar username and a password field with a sonar password.
Pass the token in the user field and leave the password field empty for token authentication.

settings.description: Settings specify which settings should be configured.

items.description: SonarSetting defines the setting of sonar.

fieldValues.description: Setting field values. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

key.description: Key is the key of the setting.

value.description: Value is the value of the setting.

valueRef.description: ValueRef is a reference to a key in a ConfigMap or a Secret.

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a ConfigMap.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

secretKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a secret.

key.description: The key of the secret to select from.

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

values.description: Setting multi value. To set several values, the parameter must be called once for each value.

url.description: Url is the url of sonar instance.

status.description: SonarStatus defines the observed state of Sonar.

connected.description: Connected shows if operator is connected to sonar.

error.description: Error represents error message if something went wrong.

processedSettings.description:
ProcessedSettings shows which settings were processed.
It is used to compare the current settings with the settings that were processed
to unset the settings that are not in the current settings.

value.description:
Value is status of sonar instance.
Possible values:
GREEN: SonarQube is fully operational
YELLOW: SonarQube is usable, but it needs attention in order to be fully operational
RED: SonarQube is not operational
